HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.FS.content: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)

HDG.EC.content: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present

HDG.OHF.content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
